intro: Valeriana chamaedryfolia, commonly known as lesser valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, usually from July to August. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties, which have been used in traditional medicine. Valeriana chamaedryfolia thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
